docs.lead_paragraph: We deeply regret to hear through the St. Thomas Times of Jan. 25th, of the death at that place on the 20th, of ISAAC B. HEADLEY, Esq., of this City, who had gone thither for his health. Mr. H. was formerly well known in Ohio, where he had been engaged in business until the failure of his health.

headline.main: ARRIVAL OF THE NORTHERN LIGHT.; From San Francisco in Twenty-two Days. $806,000 in Specie. THE REPUBLIC OF SONORA. Paper Annexation by the Fillibusters. DISASTER TO THE GOLDEN GATE. Deseret, the Sandwich Island, Tahiti, China, &c., &c. CALIFORNIA. The Golden Gate Disaster. LOWER CALIFORNIA. SANDWICH ISLANDS. FROM TAUITI.J UTAH. The Massacre of Capt. Guanlson. CHINA. A Few Days Later. Married.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Northern Light, Capt. CHURCHILL from San Juan del Norte, arrived yesterday at 2 P. M., with 400 passengers and $800,000 in specie, on freight, to CHARLES MORGAN. We received early papers and letters through the politeness of Purser R LORD, ADAMS Co's, BEDFORD Co's, and WELLS, FARGO Co.'s Expresses
docs.abstract: Proclamation of the Republic of Sonora

headline.main: FROM THE FAR WEST.; Latest Intelligence from the Selkirk Settlement.

docs.lead_paragraph: I have not communicated with you very recently, because the weather has been so inclement that we have received no news of any interest from the North, the Mountains or New Mexico. I received a letter from a friend last evening, who is now sojourning at Pembina, formerly known as Selkirk's Settlement, on the Red River of the North.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

headline.main: THE SHACKFORD &ND RESTELL CASE.; Testimony of Cordeila A. Grant. FIRST DAY. Before Justice Stuart.

docs.lead_paragraph: The investigation of this case was commenced yesterday afternoon at 3 o'clock, before Justice STUART, at the Jefferson Police Court. Mr Busteed appeared as counsel for Miss Grant. Mr. Jordan represented Caroline Lohman, (alias Madame Restell,) and George R. Shackford was defended by Ex Recorder Tallmadge. Miss Grant, Madame Restell, and Mr. Shackford were present.

headline.main: THE NEBRASKA BILL.; SPEECH OF SENATOR SUMNER, OF MASSACHISETTS.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. PRESIDENT: I approach this discussion with awe. The mighty question, with untold issues, which it involves; oppresses me. Like a portentous cloud, surcharged with irresistible storm and ruin, it seems to fill the whole heavens, making me painfully conscious how unequal I am to the occasion--how unequal, also, is all that I can say, to all that I feel.
